name: Ground_Transportation.xlsx
data: Gartner has negotiated preferred contracts with Hertz (primary) and Enterprise (secondary). Corporate ID numbers must be used to obtain negotiated rates and insurance coverages.

The policy identifies (i)  any preferred vendors by name & provides contact information / or provides location of further information such as intranet, appentix, addendum etc.(ii) include a requirement for travelers to utilize them whenever possible.(iii) Identify how the booking tool or agent will identify preferred suppliers and corporate rates or make them explicit

Rating is Partial Because: Policy mentions preferred vendors but doesn't provide complete contact information or explicit corporate rates. Content: Add contact information and details about how booking tools identify preferred suppliers and rates.

Policy states that midsize cars or smaller should be used unless there are multiple travelers riding together. For day trips more than 300 miles round-trip, rental is recommended over personal vehicle.

In destinations where company x does not have car rental provider or there is no availability with the preferred vendor, (i) the policy will identify selection guidelines (i.e. rate cap, lowest rate available, car type etc.). (ii) The policy will prohibit the use of top tier cars or/and premium high-end vehicles.When making booking arrangements company x travelers will be expected to follow selection guidelines at all times, either when engaging with the TMC travel agents or booking with the OBT  or directly with the provider.
Car Size Selection  Selection Guidelines and Standards
Policy states reimbursement will be for only midsize cars or smaller, unless there are multiple travelers riding together.

(i) Size limits allowable for rental vehicles will be specified(ii) in the policy, encouraging the size that is most appropriate for the purporse of the trip, the number of people using the vehicle and the market conditions where rental takes place. (iii) encourages car size sustainability considerations prefer electric/Hybrid cars.
Rating is Partial Because: Policy doesn't address sustainability considerations. Content: Add encouragement for electric/hybrid vehicles when available.
Car rentals must be booked at the time of air and hotel booking with the TMC. Reservations for rental cars should be made with the approved travel booking tools.

The policy states (i) Travelers should use the preferred vendors in the markets that they are available (ii) and to book reservations through the designated travel agency and/or on-line booking tool where applicable; (iii) mandating this reservation method is a best practice.
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't explicitly mandate TMC booking method. Content: Add clear mandate for TMC booking requirement.
Corporate credit card must be used for all car rental expenses.

The policy indicates (i)  the preferred method of payment for car rental expenses if it differs to the instruction in the general travel arrangements or expence management. Alternatively refers to that  (link/section/area).
You may accept a car rental upgrade only if there is no additional cost to Gartner.

The policy states (i) that upgrades are permitted if at no extra cost to the organization; otherwise,the cost of the upgrade is not reimbursable.(iii) If the policy allows for upgrade to the car type, specific circumstances should be detailed; and approval from the stated management level will be obtained prior to booking.
Consider shuttle, taxi, car service, or public transportation versus rental car cost including parking, refueling and other expenses.

The policy requires (i) that prior to renting a car, an evaluation of the cost of a personal car, taxi, car service, shuttle, or public transportation (bus, subway) versus the cost of the rental car (including related expenses such as parking, refueling and ancillaries) should be considered.
Refill the gas tank using the most economical method which generally means at a gas station. Rental car companies charge a premium to refuel.

(i) The policy states travelers to refuel vehicles prior to returning them to the rental agency where requested; (ii) if the prepaid option is included then that use must be mandated in countries where applicable.
Shared Economy Car Hire (i.e. ZipCar, Addison Lee etc.)

The policy states (i) whether shared economy apps are allowed from a risk management prespective No score :- ( If allowed: (ii) preferred vendors should be indicated and travelers should be encouraged to use them (iii) invoicing prerequisites should be indicated(iv) prior to using a shared economy car rental app, an evaluation of the cost of an regular or extended car hire booking versus the cost of the shared economy should be considered. )
Rating is Null Because: No mention of shared economy car hire services. Content: Add policy on use of shared economy services like ZipCar including preferred vendors and risk management perspective.
Accessories & Other Services (GPS, Satelite radio etc)
GPS units and other accessories are not reimbursable.

(i) The policy will permit accessories, i.e.., GPS, satellite radio, etc,  provided there is no additional charge;(ii) if GPS units are allowable for safety and security concerns, and requirements for exceptions should be listed (i.e. arriving after 9pm to an unfamiliar location)
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't address exceptions for safety concerns. Content: Add guidelines for GPS allowance in specific safety situations.
If you need to cancel your rental car reservation, cancel via same method used to book and obtain cancellation number.

(i) The policy must state reservations must be cancelled at earlierst possible (ii)The policy also states that any penalties incurred for non-cancellation of guaranteed reservations will be the responsibility of the traveler and not reimbursable.
Accidents must be reported immediately to car rental company and local authorities. Police report should be filed. Complete accident report upon return.

The policy  provides (i) clear guidelines and contact information in the event of an accident involving rental vehicles.  (ii) Contacts include law enforcement, the rental agency, a company resource and/or immediate supervisor. Refer to Travel Arrangements and Risk Management
Car Rental Loyalty or Rewards Programs
You are eligible to enroll in preferred car rental agency's club membership. If there is a cost associated it will not be reimbursed.

The policy indicates (i) whether the employee is permitted to retain the benefits of these programs for personal use; however, the policy will indicate that (ii) under no circumstances may car rentals be selected on the basis of participation in one of these programs; (iii) the policy also states that membership fees associated with joining these programs are not reimbursable.
Parking,  Tolls and City Congestion Charges
Parking fees and tolls are reimbursable with proper documentation.
The policy states  (i) whether parking fees, tolls and City Congestion Charges are reimbursable; if reimbursable, proper documentation and reporting requirements are to be included.
Traffic & Parking Violations While Driving A Rental Vehicle or a Personal Vehicle on Company Business
Traffic or parking violation tickets or fines are always the sole responsibility of the traveler and will not be reimbursed.
The policy indicates (i) penalties for parking or traffic violations are not a reimbursable expense. admin fees related to the fines are not reimbursable either
One-way rentals can be very expensive. Please understand per mile charges before booking.
(I) The policy will advise travelers to avoid one way rentals due to high cost. (However if necessary one way rental expenses will be reimbursable.)

(i) As car rental wireless service become available, the policy will advise if the traveler can utilize these services and (ii) if they are reimbursable.The policy states if (i) travelers are allowed to rent toll responders and (ii) if any fees are reimbursable.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of wireless services or toll responders. Content: Add policy on rental car wireless services and toll responder usage.
Insurance is included in rates when using CDP number for Hertz and Account Number for Enterprise. Additional insurance not required or reimbursed.

Most car rental vendor contracts and corporate charge/credit cards include some form of rental car insurance coverage when the designated corporate charge/credit cards is used to rent the car.  (i) the extent of coverage available from the corporate card or other company-sponsored sources should be detailed in the policy.(ii) Submission of additional insurance should be non-reimbursable when equivalent insurance is offered by the preferred rate or  corporate credit card.

The policy states (i)  that the employee should have a valid drivers license suitable for driving the type of vehicle hired and permitted by local law. if car hire is allowed to all drivers and if there are special conditions for young drivers
Rating is Null Because: No mention of driver's license requirements. Content: Add policy on valid driver's license requirements and conditions for young drivers.
All cars shall be equipped related to local weather and road conditions. Check market requirements when booking.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of winterization requirements. Content: Add policy on weather-related equipment requirements.

The policy advises that (i) the supplier should be informed about any cross border rentals as restrictions might apply. (ii) The traveler needs to make sure Rules and Regulations of Destination City/Country are fulfilled (winterization, congestion charges etc.)
Rating is Null Because: No mention of cross border rental requirements. Content: Add policy on cross border rentals and related restrictions.

For domestic as well as for Cross Border rentals different cities might have different rules and regulations. The traveler needs to make sure Rules and Regulations of any destination City/Country are fulfilled (winterization, congestion charges, parking permits, car type permit etc.)
Rating is Null Because: No mention of city/country entry restrictions. Content: Add policy on local rules and regulations for different cities/countries.

The policy states: (i) that the number of kilometer/miles included in the car rental agreement may vary from country to country. (ii) reference location of agreement / appendix with further information
Rating is Null Because: No mention of kilometer/mileage limitations. Content: Add policy on mileage limitations by country.
Check car for defects before leaving lot. Note any defects on rental agreement.

The policy states that the driver(i) should accurately fill the Damage Report before returning the car to the supplier. (ii) For bigger damages that might affect the critical functionalities please contact the supplier immediately.
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't fully address damage reporting procedures. Content: Add clear guidelines for damage reporting process.

Policy states (i) whether Employees travelling privately can make use of this agreement. If so, (ii) the agreement number for private car is XXXXX, and for vans & trucks it is XXXXXX.(iii) In case of private rentals, you must sign appropriate insurances both domestic and internationally. The company is not an assurer for private car rental.(iv) Clarify which employees are eligible to use the agreement rates (consultants outsourced specifications)
Rating is Null Because: No mention of private rental policies. Content: Add policy on personal use of corporate agreements.
The policy states (i) if a short-term lease is appropriate for the short term assignment (30-45 days).  (ii) Reference to a preferred vendor and insurance coverage required is recommended.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of extended rental policies. Content: Add policy on short-term leases for extended assignments.
Car Transfers Taxi, Transfers, Ride Haling Apps, Limousine/ Car Service
Taxis are usually the most cost-effective mode of ground transportation in major metropolitan areas.

The policy states (i) that set guidelines for use of taxis including distance, spending guidelines, preferred vendors, access to and use of taxi chits and proper documentation required for reimbursement.
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't provide specific guidelines. Content: Add spending guidelines and documentation requirements.
Car Transfers Taxi, Transfers, Ride Haling Apps, Limousine/ Car Service
Uber premium services (LUX, SUV, Black Car Service) are not approved levels of service for taxi reimbursement.

The policy states (i) whether ride hailing apps are allowed from a R&S perspective 
If allowed: (ii) preferred vendors should be indicated and travelers should be encouraged to use (iii) invoicing prerequisites should be indicated (iv) prior to using a hailing app, an evaluation of the cost of a personal car, taxi, car service, shuttle, or public transportation (bus, subway) versus the cost of the rental car should be considered. (v) rate caps for frequent routes could be considered.
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't fully address ride hailing apps. Content: Add preferred vendors and cost evaluation guidelines.
Car Transfers Taxi, Transfers, Ride Haling Apps, Limousine/ Car Service

Limo service can be used when: two or more people travel together to airport, cost is no more expensive than other available transportation, traveling internationally for safe service, or business justifies usage.

The policy states (i) that set guidelines for use of car services or limousine services. (ii) The policy will include level of employee, distance, spending guidelines, preferred vendors, reservation instructions, and proper documentation required for reimbursement. (iii) The policy will advise the type of car allowed.(iv) includes Appendix with Market exceptions for safety reasons (ex. India, Mexico, Brazil, South Africa etc.)
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't include market exceptions. Content: Add appendix with market exceptions for safety reasons.
Public Transportation including Buses and Shuttles
Public Transportation including Buses and Shuttles
Use public transport, share ground transportation whenever possible. Use airport/hotel shuttle if available.

The policy states  (i) travelers are to use public transport, share ground transportation whenever possible and that the most economical mode be used (i.e., must use airport/hotel shuttle if available), taking employee safety and wellbeing into consideration.  (ii) The policy will include required documentation for reimbursement.(iii) includes Appendix with Market exceptions for safety reasons or refers to location with further information from R&S department (ex. India, Mexico, Brazil, South Africa etc.).
Rating is Partial Because: Doesn't address market exceptions. Content: Add safety considerations for specific markets.
Use of Personal Vehicle for Business Purposes
Associates will be reimbursed at flat mileage rate. Includes wear and tear, maintenance, fuel. Parking and tolls reimbursable. Driver responsible for insurance and traffic violations.

The policy states (i) when personal car usage is appropriate and provide mileage reimbursement rates and require that a mileage log be maintained to track distance traveled. 
(ii) The policy will also note that any damage, etc. to the personal vehicle is the responsibility of the driver and not reimbursable.The policy states (iii) that the driver is responsible for carrying adequate insurance on the personal vehicle to cover use in a business-related manner based on local law requirements.

The policy states;  (i) travelers to consider rail transportation if it is available and more cost effective than air travel or car rental. (ii) Established separate guidelines for domestic and international rail travel that encompass class of service allowed, number of hours and receipt requirements; (iii)  Provides time guidelines for when it is permissible / advisable to use rail service over air.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of rail vs air guidelines. Content: Add policy comparing rail and air travel options.
The policy states; (i) preferred vendors are identified (ii) the policy messages that the client has preferred rates for travelers to utilize
Rating is Null Because: No mention of preferred rail suppliers. Content: Add preferred rail vendors and corporate rates.
The policy states; (i) Travelers to use the preferred vendors and to book all reservations through the designated travel agency and/or on-line booking tool and/or any other approved channel;
Rating is Null Because: No mention of rail reservation instructions. Content: Add booking process for rail travel.
(i) The policy states use of the company corporate card is required for payment if applicable
Rating is Null Because: No mention of rail payment methods. Content: Add payment guidelines for rail travel.

The policy states (i) Indicate the approved cabin class based on destination/distance/time; a best practice is indicated if (ii) Economy/Second/Standard is the appropriate cabin class for short duration trains with Business class permissible if the destination exceeds a specified number of hours (not less than four hours).(iii) specify if cabin class usage differs for Domestic, International routes.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of rail class of service. Content: Add policy on approved cabin classes.

The policy states; (i) if upgrades are permissible based on number of hours to destination (minimum of 4 hours is suggested)  (ii) approval required by a supervisor (iii) if cost of the upgrade is reimbursable
Rating is Null Because: No mention of rail upgrades. Content: Add policy on upgrade eligibility and approval.
The policy states; (i)  if the traveler can utilize the rail wi-fi services and (ii) if they are reimbursable.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of rail WiFi services. Content: Add policy on WiFi usage and reimbursement.

The policy states (i)  whether the employee is permitted to retain the benefits of these programs for personal use; however, the policy should indicate that  (ii) under no circumstances may train selection be selected on the basis of participation in one of these programs; (iii) the policy also states that membership fees associated with joining these programs are not reimbursable. (iv) the policy also states that the cost of this pass can be reimbursed if the frequent traveler justifies higher travel cost savings. (if different to travel arrangements)
Rating is Null Because: No mention of rail loyalty programs. Content: Add policy on rail rewards programs.

(i) The policy should reference the use of ferries and/or channel tunnel services, including spending guidelines (i.e., must use airport shuttle if available), preferred vendors, and required documentation for reimbursement.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of ferry/tunnel services. Content: Add guidelines for ferry and channel tunnel usage.
The policy states (i) whether bike rentals are permissible and (ii) if the expense is reimbursable.
Rating is Null Because: No mention of bike rentals. Content: Add policy on bike rental permissibility.
